results.title: Burt Dow, deep-water man (K)
results.creator_credit: Vaclav Bedrich, Morton Schindel, Zdenka Deitchova, Kratky Film and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: An animated film of adventure in the high seas. When Burt Dow, a retired seaman, sets sail in his boat the Tidley-Idley to fish for cod, he ends up inside a whale. The whale refuses to let Burt leave, so Burt dreams up a uniquely artistic solution. Based on the book by Robert McCloskey. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vaclav Bedrich, Morton Schindel, Zdenka Deitchova, Kratky Film and Weston Woods Studios

results.title: Burroughs
results.creator_credit: Howard Brookner, Alan Yentob and Citifilm Works
results.brief_description: William Burroughs, the noted American novelist, is the subject of this documentary filmed over five years and including material shot earlier, in black and white, by British film director, Antony Balch. In cinema verite style, director Howard Brookner shows Burroughs as a private person reminiscing about his inspirations and exploits. Writers and reviewers appearing in this film include Alan Ginsberg and Jack Kerouac. Contents include: Reel 1 - Nova Express, the Place of Dead Roads, Cities of the Red Night, The Wild Boys, Naked Lunch Reel 2 - Naked Lunch, Nova Express Reel 3 - The Place of Dead Roads
results.creator_credit_for_label: Howard Brookner, Alan Yentob and Citifilm Works

results.title: Burra, South Australia
results.brief_description: A film on the copper mining carried out at Burra in the early 1800’s. Historic buildings are shown, as are pump houses and ventilation chimneys built on the copper fields by the Cornish and Welshmen. Photography by Ron Horner.
results.description: A film on the copper mining carried out at Burra in the early 1800’s. Historic buildings are shown, as are pump houses and ventilation chimneys built on the copper fields by the Cornish and Welshmen. Photography by Ron Horner.

results.title: Burns
results.brief_description: This occupational health and safety video is suitable for anyone needing to learn about the crucial stage of first aid in burns treatment. It demonstrates how if burns are treated straight after they happen, it can mean the difference between life and death.
results.description: This occupational health and safety video is suitable for anyone needing to learn about the crucial stage of first aid in burns treatment. It demonstrates how if burns are treated straight after they happen, it can mean the difference between life and death.

results.title: Burn care: a life at stake
results.creator_credit: John Ralmon and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: Aimed at teaching first aid for burns. Shows how to assess the extent and degree of burns, and how to treat thermal, electrical and chemical burns before medical aid is administered. Includes interviews with burn victims, medical photographs illustrating various kinds of burns and realistic dramatisations of burn accidents.

results.title: Burma Railway
results.brief_description: A documentary covering the imprisonment of the ill-fated Australian 8th Division after the fall of Singapore in 1942, and the construction by the prisoners of war of the Burma Railway.

results.title: Buried treasure
results.creator_credit: Donald Carter, Coal Utilization Council and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: An account of the British coal industry covering: the geological formation of coal; the layout and ventilation of a modern mine; the work of individual coal miners; the organization of the various shifts throughout the day; methods employed to extract coal from the coal face; cleaning, grading and transport of coal at the pit-head. “Supervised by the Coal Utilization Council in association with John Grierson and Arthur Elton”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Carter, Coal Utilization Council and Gaumont-British Instructional

results.title: Buried cities
results.brief_description: Shows the excavations and reconstructions of the cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum. Gives an account of the eruption of Vesuvius in 79 AD and depicts life at the time.

results.title: Bunny
results.creator_credit: Edwin James Lynch, Philip Ellery and Western Australia Film Council
results.brief_description: A young girl, Jane (Tamara Liffers), left to her own devices at home proceeds to go about her morning ritual. She feeds herself, her pet fish and dog then goes to secretly feed the next door neighbour’s pet rabbit. Jane hides when she spots Mrs. Nextdoor (Tiffany Evans) entering the garden who unbeknowns to her is about to bury the dead rabbit. Jane panics when her dog has brought in the dead carcus of the rabbit believing that the dog has killed the rabbit. Jane’s matter of fact approach to right the situation illustrates the naivity and simplicity of a child’s mind. Cast also includes Ivor Bowen.
